alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 2:57AM EST until January 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Interior Hancock, Southern Penobscot and Coastal Hancock Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 15 minutes. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and powerlines.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot
